meanings.type: Noun, Suru verb, Transitive verb, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. breathing; respiration 酸素は私たちが呼吸すると肺の中に取り込まれる。Oxygen is taken into our lungs when we breathe.
2. knack; trick; secret (of doing something) 英語の発音の呼吸がなかなか飲み込めない。I still can't get the knack of English pronunciation.
3. harmony; balance; synchronization; accord
4. short interval; short pause See also 一呼吸
5. Breathing Breathing is the process that moves air in and out of the... Read more

meanings.type: Noun, Suru verb, Transitive verb, Intransitive verb

4. short interval; short pause See also 一呼吸
5. Breathing Breathing is the process that moves air in and out of the... Read more

sentences.translation: Oxygen is taken into our lungs when we breathe.
I still can't get the knack of English pronunciation.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'bu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to call out (to); to call; to invoke あなたが呼べば、彼は来るでしょう。He will come if you call him.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'bu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to summon (a doctor, etc.) パーティーに呼んでもらいましたが今回は行けません。You invited me to your party, but I can't make it this time.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'bu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to invite 「本当に警察を呼びたいのか」と僕は彼女に尋ねた。"Are you sure you want to call the police?" I asked her.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'bu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to designate; to name; to brand あなたをケパと呼ぶことにします。You will be called Cephas.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'bu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to garner (support, etc.); to gather この映画は大変な人気を呼んだ。This movie has won great popularity.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'bu' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to take as one's wife Archaic, See also 娶る
喚ぶ 【よぶ】
喚ぶ: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: He will come if you call him.
You invited me to your party, but I can't make it this time.
"Are you sure you want to call the police?" I asked her.
You will be called Cephas.
This movie has won great popularity.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to call (someone) to (the door, phone, etc.); to tell (someone) to come; to call up (on the phone); to summon; to page; to invoke (e.g. a spirit) どうぞ彼を電話口に呼び出してください。Please call him to the telephone.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to invoke (e.g. a subroutine); to call; to open (e.g. a file) Computing4つのレジスタは、呼び出された関数側が保存する。The contents of the four registers are preserved by the called subroutine.
呼出す 【よびだす】

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to call (someone) to (the door, phone, etc.); to tell (someone) to come; to call up (on the phone); to summon; to page; to invoke (e.g. a spirit) どうぞ彼を電話口に呼び出してください。Please call him to the telephone.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to invoke (e.g. a subroutine); to call; to open (e.g. a file) Computing4つのレジスタは、呼び出された関数側が保存する。The contents of the four registers are preserved by the called subroutine.
呼出す 【よびだす】

sentences.translation: Please call him to the telephone.
The contents of the four registers are preserved by the called subroutine.

meanings.meaning: 1. to call out to; to hail; to address 遠くから誰かが私に呼びかけているのが聞こえた。I heard someone calling me from a distance.
2. to appeal 警官はすりに対する注意を呼びかけた。The policeman called attention to the problem of pickpockets.
呼び掛ける 【よびかける】、呼掛ける 【よびかける】
1. to call out to; to hail; to address 遠くから誰かが私に呼びかけているのが聞こえた。I heard someone calling me from a distance.
2. to appeal 警官はすりに対する注意を呼びかけた。The policeman called attention to the problem of pickpockets.
呼び掛ける 【よびかける】、呼掛ける 【よびかける】

sentences.translation: I heard someone calling me from a distance.
The policeman called attention to the problem of pickpockets.

meanings.meaning: 1. to (call and) stop; to call (someone) to stop; to hail (e.g. a taxi)

1. call; summons; paging; curtain call See also 呼び出す よびだす呼び出しをお願いします。I'd like to page someone.
2. call; invocation Computing
3. usher who calls the names of wrestlers, sweeps the ring, etc. Sumo
4. telephone number at which a person without a telephone can be reached Abbreviation, See also 呼び出し電話
5. box-shaped area containing clean water for rinsing oneself (in an Edo-period bathhouse) Archaic, See also 陸湯
6. high-ranking prostitute in the Yoshiwara district (Edo period) Archaic
7. unlicensed prostitute in the Fukagawa red-light district (Edo period) Archaic
